tooltip.configurable_everything.biome: Enable or disable the Biome config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.biome_pl: Enable or disable the Biome Placement config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.datafixe: Enable or disable the Datafixer config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.fluid: Enable or disable the Fluid config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.surface_: Enable or disable the Surface Rule config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.apply_da: Enable or disable the datapacks folder in config/configurable_everything.
tooltip.configurable_everything.datapack: Enable or disable biome changes from datapacks.
Enable or disable biome placement changes from datapacks.
tooltip.configurable_everything.json5_su: Enable or disable support for JSON5 files in datapacks.
tooltip.configurable_everything.datafixe:
The list of fixers to use for data fixing.
Each fixer contains an old id and a new id, and will replace all instances of the old id with the new id.
However, if the old id is still found in the registry, it will not be replaced.
The new ID to replace the old ID with.
tooltip.configurable_everything.override:
Whether or not to convert all IDs
whether or not a valid entry exists
WARNING: THIS CAN POTENTIALLY CAUSE UNWANTED
EFFECTS TO YOUR WORLDS, USE WITH CAUTION
tooltip.configurable_everything.data_ver:
The data fixer's main data version. Increment this when you add a new schema.
Any schemas with a data version higher than this will be ignored.
tooltip.configurable_everything.schemas:
The list of schemas to use for data fixing.
Each schema has a data version and a list of data fix entries.
Each data fix entry has a type and a list of fixers.
The four types are "biome", "block", "entity", and "item".
Although, it is recommended to use a registry fixer for items instead of a schema fixer.
Each fixer contains an old id and a new id, and will replace all instances of the old id with the new id.
However, if the old id is still found in the registry, it will not be replaced.
The data version of the schema.
The list of data fix entries to use for this schema.

The type of data fix entry.
The four types are "biome", "block", "entity", and "item".
tooltip.configurable_everything.registry:
The list of registry fixers to use for data fixing.
Each registry fixer has a registry key and a list of fixers.
The ID of the registry that will be fixed.
tooltip.configurable_everything.entity: Enable or disable the Entity config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.sound_ev:
Enables Flyby sounds that are linked to different Sound Events.
Individual sounds can be controlled via config file.
tooltip.configurable_everything.dig_spee:
Modifies the Player's dig speed.
This is a percentage.
tooltip.configurable_everything.entity_a: Contains options to amplify entity attributes.
The entity type to apply the attribute amplifier to.

The name of the entity type to apply the attribute amplifier to.
Ignored if blank.
The attribute amplifiers to apply to the entity selection.
The attribute to apply the amplifier to.
The amplifier to apply to the attribute.
tooltip.configurable_everything.entity_x: A list of entities and how much experience they should drop.
Lets you change how much experience an entity will drop.
The type of entity to modify.
THe new amount of experience the entity will drop.
tooltip.configurable_everything.entity_f: A list of entities and sounds to be played when they fly past the player.
An entity and the sound to play when it flies past the player.
The type of entity to add a flyby sound to.
The data of the flyby sound to be played.
The sound category the flyby sound will play in.
The volume of the flyby sound.
The pitch the flyby sound will play in.
tooltip.configurable_everything.entity_h: Contains options for Entity Hurt Effects.
Effects to be applied to an entity type when it gets hurt.
Effects to be applied to an entity type when it gets hurt.
tree what the fuck is this.
Effects to be applied once the entity gets hurt.
The effect to apply to the entity.
The effect to apply to the entity.

The level of the effect.
Set to 0 for level I, 1, for II, etc.
Whether or not the effect is ambient.
Whether or not effect particles will appear.
Whether or not the effect icon will display.
tooltip.configurable_everything.entity_s: A list of entities and spotting icons associated with them.
An icon that displays above an entity.
The type of entity to add a spotting icon to.
The distance at which the icon will begin to fade out.
The distance at which the icon will completely fade out.
tooltip.configurable_everything.baby_zom: Whether or not Baby Zombies spawn sprint particles.
tooltip.configurable_everything.zombies_: Whether or not Zombies will actively avoid the sun.
tooltip.configurable_everything.ignore_z: Allows Zombies to break Doors outside Hard difficulty.
tooltip.configurable_everything.all_zomb: Whether or not all Zombies can break Doors.
tooltip.configurable_everything.ignore_z: Allows Zombie reinforcements to spawn outside Hard difficulty.
tooltip.configurable_everything.full_zom: Whether or not Zombie reinforcements should spawn 100% of the time.
tooltip.configurable_everything.skeleton:
Skeletons will ignore the game's difficulty when firing arrows.
This will be equivalent to Hard difficulty.
Whether or not Skeletons will actively avoid the sun.
tooltip.configurable_everything.flaming_:
Enable or disable Flint & Steel functionality when a
flaming Arrow hits a block or entity.
tooltip.configurable_everything.game: Enable or disable the Game config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.window_t:
The text displayed on Minecraft's window.
Leave field empty to ignore.
tooltip.configurable_everything.game_ser:
Changes Minecraft's game series. Is 'main' by default.
Leave field empty to ignore.
tooltip.configurable_everything.screen_s: Enable or disable the Screen Shake config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.sound_sc: A list of screen shakes that will apply when a specific sound is played.
A screen shake that will apply when the specified sound is played.
The sound that triggers the screen shake.
The intensity of the screen shake.
The duration of the screen shake in ticks.
How many ticks after starting the screen shake should begin to soften.

How far away the screen shake can be felt.
The screen shake will become less intense the closer you get to this distance.
tooltip.configurable_everything.dragon_r: Whether or not the Ender Dragon's respawning will cause the screen to shake.
tooltip.configurable_everything.explosio: Whether or not explosions will cause the screen to shake.
tooltip.configurable_everything.splash_t: Enable or disable the Splash Text config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.added_sp: Strings that should be added to the main menu's splash texts.
tooltip.configurable_everything.removed_:
Strings representing splash texts that should be removed.
Must be the exact text.
tooltip.configurable_everything.splash_c: The color splash text will be displayed in
tooltip.configurable_everything.world: Enable or disable the World config.
tooltip.configurable_everything.fix_sun_:
Changes how the position of the Sun and Moon rotate so they
will smoothly move across the sky as opposed to snap to
a new position. Noticeable with higher day time speeds.
tooltip.configurable_everything.disable_: Enable or disable the experimental warning screen when creating or loading worlds.
